head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Albany: Casino Magnate Back In Racing Bid

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Albany: Casino Magnate Back In Racing Bid

body.head.byline: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE; Compiled by John Sullivan

block.p: Just weeks after abandoning a bid for New York's thoroughbred horse racing franchise, the casino magnate Steve Wynn announced yesterday that he would join one of the four consortiums still vying for the prize. Mr. Wynn, along with two real estate developers, Steven Roth and Richard D. Bronson, will invest in Excelsior Racing Associates. At stake are rights to run the Saratoga, Aqueduct and Belmont racetracks, which take in $2.7 billion a year in bets. The move comes on the eve of public hearings at which the bidders will present their investment plans to a panel picked by Gov. Eliot Spitzer.
